Pre-Game Insights: England will be up against Sri Lanka in a must-win game as the former seeks semi-final spot in the ongoing T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia.

Jos Buttler-led side is currently stationed at second spot in the points table with two wins out of four games and will seek to win the upcoming fixture to confirm their spot among top-two in the Group 1.
Sri Lanka will have an uphill task ahead of them as they have struggled on most of the occasions in the competition and England looks formidable side in front of them.
Kusal Mendis can be added in the fantasy squad considering his most recent performances in the tournament.
Dhananjaya de Silva is another prolific middle-order batter who can earn valuable points.
Bhanuka Rajapaksha, skipper Dasun Shanaka and Wanindu Hasaranga must be picked from the squad as this trio possesses immense potential to outplay any quality side in the world.
From the bowling department, Maheesh Theekshana, Kasun Rajitha and Chamika Karunaratne are three quality bowlers who should be considered while forming a fantasy squad.
England skipper Jos Buttler makes direct entry in the fantasy squad as he has been batting brilliantly in the competition.
Alex Hales also played a superb knock of 50 runs in 40 deliveries and should be added in the fantasy squad.
Moeen Ali, Harry Brooks and Liam Livingstone add a lot of balance to the middle-order, but Stokes has been struggling with the bat.
Harry Brooks and Moeen can be added in the fantasy squad as they looked in good touch against Ireland.
Mark Wood, Chris Woakes, and Sam Curran makes England a good bowling side and these players should make a mandatory entry in the fantasy squad.
